Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel

  • public class GameModel
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameModel(int width, int height)
      Constructor to initialize the model to a given size of board.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void click(int i, int j)
      Sets the status of the dot at location (i,j) to clicked and update the neighborhood accordingly
      int getHeight()
      Getter method for the height of the game
      int getNumberOfSteps()
      Getter method for the current number of steps
      int getWidth()
      Getter method for the width of the game
      boolean isFinished()
      The method isFinished returns true iff the game is finished, that is, the board is all ON (the model is "true" everywhere)
      boolean isON(int i, int j)
      returns true if the dot at location (i,j) in the model is lit, false otherwise
      void randomize()
      Restarts the game with a solveable random board instead of a clear board.
      void reset()
      Resets the model to (re)start a game.
      void set(int i, int j, boolean value)
      Sets the location (i,j) to value
      void setSolution()
      computes a shortest solution for the current game and records it in the variable solution
      boolean solutionSelects(int i, int j)
      Returns true if there is a current solution in the model and that solution has the dot at row i, column j selected (ON)
      java.lang.String toString()
      Builds a String representation of the model

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        Constructor to initialize the model to a given size of board.

        height - the height of the board

    • Method Detail

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Getter method for the height of the game
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute heightOfGame

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Getter method for the width of the game
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute widthOfGame

      • isON

        public boolean isON(int i,
                    int j)
        returns true if the dot at location (i,j) in the model is lit, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the dot in the model
        j - the column of the dot in the model
        Returns:
        the status of the dot at location (i,j)in the model

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the model to (re)start a game. The previous game (if there is one) is cleared up .

      • set

        public void set(int i,
                int j,
                boolean value)
        Sets the location (i,j) to value
        Parameters:
        i - the x coordinate of the dot
        j - the y coordinate of the dot
        value - the value of the dot at location (i,j)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Builds a String representation of the model
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the model

      • randomize

        public void randomize()
        Restarts the game with a solveable random board instead of a clear board.

      • click

        public void click(int i,
                  int j)
        Sets the status of the dot at location (i,j) to clicked and update the neighborhood accordingly
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the dot in the model
        j - the column of the dot in the model

      • getNumberOfSteps

        public int getNumberOfSteps()
        Getter method for the current number of steps
        Returns:
        the current number of steps

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        The method isFinished returns true iff the game is finished, that is, the board is all ON (the model is "true" everywhere)
        Returns:
        true if the game is finished, false otherwise

      • setSolution

        public void setSolution()
        computes a shortest solution for the current game and records it in the variable solution

      • solutionSelects

        public boolean solutionSelects(int i,
                               int j)
        Returns true if there is a current solution in the model and that solution has the dot at row i, column j selected (ON)
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the dot in the model
        j - the column of the dot in the model
        Returns:
        true if solution != null and solution.get(j,i)==true
